Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the age range of foreign-born residents in the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program by suggesting they could be 40 or 41 years old, while they can only be up to 36 years old.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that DACA recipients can only be up to 36 years old, not 40 or 41 years old.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the statement that foreign-born residents in the DACA program could be 40 or 41 years old.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by suggesting that the age range of DACA recipients is a relevant factor in discussing a "clean DACA bill" or a path to citizenship.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the provided claim.
